meta.comment: WARNING: Pre-alpha test service, data may not be up to date

item.message: We are expecting high levels due to a combination of a tidal surge and high winds. Locations affected are riverside and rural properties in West Caister, Runham, Acle and Stokesby. Roads likely to be affected are the A47, A1064 and Acle Bridge. We will continue to monitor levels closely and update this message as necessary.

We are expecting high tide levels due to a combination of a tidal surge and high winds.

The forecast high water is due at Great Yarmouth at 9:15pm on the 21st October 2014. 

Locations affected are riverside properties in Reedham, Cantley and Brundall. Roads affected include Ferry Road in Reedham, the A47 and the railway line between Reedham and Brundall.

We will continue to monitor levels closely and update this message as necessary.

We are expecting high tide levels due to a combination of a tidal surge and high winds. The forecast high water is due at Lowestoft at 08:30 am on 22nd October 2014. 
The predicted astronomical tide level is 0.97 m AODN.
The forecast surge height is 1.32 m.
The forecast tide level is 2.29 m AODN.
The forecast wind direction is North West.
The forecast wind strength is force 7.
mAODN is a standard measure used across the UK for height above average sea level.  It is different to Chart Datum.
Flooding is expected for The Southwold Harbour area, Ferry road, the bottoms of Queens Road and Constitution Hill, North Road, the bottom of Pier Avenue and Mights Road in Southwold. Bridge Road and Hillside Road in Reydon. 
This warning is in force until 10:30 am on 22nd October 2014. We will continue to monitor levels closely and update this message as necessary.

We are expecting high tide levels due to a combination of a tidal surge and high winds. 

The forecast high water is due at Harwich at 11:30pm on 21st October 2014.

The predicted astronomical tide level is 1.89 m AODN.

The forecast surge height is 0.91 m.
The forecast tide level is 2.8 m AODN.

The forecast wind direction is West North West.
The forecast wind strength is force 7.

mAODN is a standard measure used across the UK for height above average sea level.  It is different to Chart Datum.

Properties are expected to flood at Bawdsey Quay and in front of the flood defences at Felixstowe Ferry.

This warning is in force until 1:30am on the 22nd October 2014. 

We will continue to monitor levels closely and update this message as necessary.

We are expecting high tide levels due to a combination of a tidal surge and high winds. We are expecting to issue this warning again for Wednesday morning's tide. 

The forecast high water is due at Cromer at 6:45pm on the 21st October 2014. 

The predicted astronomical tide level is 1.84 m AODN.

The forecast surge height is 0.69 m.
The forecast tide level is 2.53 m AODN.

The forecast wind direction is West North West.
The forecast wind strength is force 9.

mAODN is a standard measure used across the UK for height above average sea level.  It is different to Chart Datum.

Properties are at risk on Sea View, Ann Stannard Way, Keswick Way, Walcott Road in Keswick. The Coast Road, St Helen's Road, Helena Road, Poplar Drive, Archibald Drive, Lynton Road, The Crescent and Ostend Place in Walcott. Seaview Crescent, Ostend Gap, Ostend Road and Horizon Views in Ostend.

We will continue to monitor levels closely and update this message as necessary.
